result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius S McGee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  To be paid during period of Extended Supervision or civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentences.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Dineka R. or Nyah M.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
$1,604.81 to Dineka R.  (same stated on 15CF2116, restitution assessment on 15CF2116).

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (37 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING commencing JULY 23, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1 and #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the Use of a Dangerous Weapon Enhancer on COUNT #2.

AS TO COUNT #2 (without the Enhancer Use of a Dangerous Weapon): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to any other sentences), with credit for 90 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Dineka R. or Nyah M.    
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the 
   Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Pay restitution in the amount of $1,604.81 to Dineka R.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.  mld

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  New defense counsel is in receipt of the discovery from prior counsel.  Medical records needed by defense counsel.  New defense counsel does not object to the consolidation of cases 2015CF1835 and 2015CF2116.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-23-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Consent to Substitutionof Attorneys, signed and filed.
-- Attorney Allison RItter is hereby substituted as counsel for Attorney Glen Kulkoski.    mld
received and filed.   mld

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Original Information will be filed by the State on the next date.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for trial: Cases 2015CF1835 and 2015CF2116 with co-defendant case 2015CF2117.   Defense counsel may address the consolidation of cases in the future, if needed, per the Court.   Case adjourned for Arraignment Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-16-2015 at 8:30 am.   

Attorney Allison Ritter appeared later that same date, and advised that she had been retained by defendant as new counsel.  Attorney Ritter advised of the next court date on 6-16-2015 at 8:30 am for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4.   mld

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Marshall Jones and Milwaukee Police Officer Jason Daering.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Information was not filed, as defendant has new charges forthcoming, and that case will need to be calendared for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4, per the State.  Case adjourned for Arraignment and Status Conference in Branch 4 on 5-19-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Dineka R., Nyah M., and Greg M., until further order of the Court.   mld
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Dineka R; Nyah M; Greg M. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
UPON RELEASE FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
